Package bricker.brick_strategies

Class CameraChangeStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bricker.brick_strategies.BasicCollisionStrategy
      • bricker.brick_strategies.CameraChangeStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollisionStrategy
    public class CameraChangeStrategy
extends BasicCollisionStrategy
    CameraChangeStrategy extends BasicCollisionStrategy and focuses on altering the camera's focus to the ball upon collision. This strategy adds a dynamic visual effect to the game by shifting the camera's view, thereby enhancing the player's visual experience and increasing the game's immersion.

    The strategy, when triggered by a collision event, activates a camera that follows the ball, creating a more engaging and visually stimulating gameplay environment. This change in perspective can add a new layer of challenge and excitement to the game.

    Usage: - Instantiate this class with the necessary game manager, game objects, the ball, and window controller. - Attach this strategy to a GameObject. - On collision, the camera focus shifts to the ball, enhancing the game's visual dynamics.

    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraChangeStrategy

        public CameraChangeStrategy​(BrickerGameManager gameManager,
                            danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection gameObjects,
                            Ball ball,
                            danogl.gui.WindowController windowController)
        Constructs a CameraChangeStrategy instance. Initializes the strategy with the game manager, game objects, the ball, and the window controller for managing camera behavior.
        Parameters:
        gameManager - The main game manager, responsible for managing game states and interactions.
        gameObjects - Collection of all game objects, used for accessing and modifying game elements.
        ball - The Ball object, which will become the focus of the camera in this strategy.
        windowController - Controller for managing the game window, essential for handling camera focus and behavior.

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a unique tag identifying this specific strategy. The tag is useful for debugging or identifying the strategy during gameplay.
        Specified by:
        getTag in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        getTag in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Returns:
        A string representing the unique tag of this collision strategy.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision​(danogl.GameObject thisObj,
                        danogl.GameObject otherObj,
                        danogl.util.Counter bricksCounter,
                        boolean originalBehavior)
        Handles the collision event and manages the camera's focus and behavior. This method is invoked when a collision occurs with an object using this strategy. It activates a camera that focuses on the ball, providing a dynamic and immersive visual experience.
        Specified by:
        onCollision in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        onCollision in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Parameters:
        thisObj - The GameObject associated with this collision strategy.
        otherObj - The GameObject that has collided with thisObj.
        bricksCounter - A counter tracking the number of bricks in the game, important for some strategies.
        originalBehavior - A boolean flag indicating whether the original behavior of the collision should also occur.
